required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiological and Clinical Outcome After Screw Osteosynthesis of Radial Head Fractures
clinical_study.official_title: Radiological and Clinical Outcome After Screw Osteosynthesis of Radial Head Fractures

brief_summary.textblock: This cohort study investigates radiological and clinical outcome after screw osteosynthesis of radial head fractures with associated injuries (such as rupture of the interosseous membrane and collateral ligaments). Interpretation of radiographs 3 and 9 months post- surgery and patient surveys will be analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in status of bone healing assessed by radiographs
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of radiographs with regard to bone healing (cortical bone, dislocation of fracture and dislocation of screws)

secondary_outcome.measure: elbow status assessed by Mayo Elbow Score (MEPS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point, assessment 2 to 7 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A clinician-completed scoring system used to evaluate the level of disability in the elbow, assessing pain, functional status (based on number tasks performed), range of motion and joint stability. Clinical information is rated based on a 100 points scale: <60 - poor 60-74 - fair 75-89 - good 90-100 - excellent

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient reported outcome of elbow surgery assessed by Oxford Elbow Score (OES)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point, assessment 2 to 7 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The Oxford Elbow Score has 12 items (questions) with 5 response options each. Each item response is scored 0 to 4, with 0 representing greater severity. Underlying the 12 items are 3 domains (sub-scales): Elbow pain, Elbow function and Social-psychological domain. Scores for each domain are calculated as the sum of each individual item score within that domain, which is then converted to a metric of 0 — 100 (lower score representing greater severity).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient reported outcome assessed by Quick Dash
secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point, assessment 2 to 7 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Quick Dash is a questionnaire that measures an individual's ability to complete tasks, absorb forces, and severity of symptoms. The QuickDASH tool uses a 5-point Likert scale from which the patient can select an appropriate number corresponding to his/her severity level/ function level. Scoring ranges from 1 = no difficulty to 5 = unable to do. A higher score indicates a greater level of disability and severity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: single time point, assessment 2 to 7 years after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment whether the patient is able to perform the original job activity as before surgery

intervention.description: patient survey on clinical outcome after screw osteosynthesis of radial head fractures
analysis of radiographs on radiological outcome after screw osteosynthesis of radial head fractures

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing screw osteosynthesis of radial head fractures at Universitätsspital Basel between June 2010 until June 2016

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- screw osteosynthesis of radial head fractures
Exclusion Criteria:
- unable to give consent
- dementia

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Orthopaedics and Traumatology, University Hospital Basel

facility.name: Department of Orthopaedics and Traumatology, University Hospital Basel
